info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 8:54PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Garfield. In west central Colorado, Mesa. This includes the Pine Gulch burn scar. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 852 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over the Pine Gulch burn scar. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.2 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... North Dry Fork, Middle Dry Fork, Kimball Creek, Big Salt Wash, South Dry Fork, Corcoran Wash, Little Salt Wash, Roan Creek and Coal Gulch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Garfield and North Central Mesa Counties
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
